POST.MESSAGE:
I am posting a reply given by our Aakash expert, Srikant:

-------- Original Message --------
Subject:     Re: [Fwd: CL 692-2012-2: Proxy settings for Aakash app]
Date:     Fri, 25 Jan 2013 09:38:22 +0530
From:     Srikant <u.srikant.patnaik@gmail.com>
To:     Kannan Moudgalya <kannan@iitb.ac.in>
CC:     sachin patil <iclcoolster@gmail.com>, shubhamgupta@iitb.ac.in
References:     <5101E1AA.5050404@iitb.ac.in>



Deas Shubham,

This is a problem with android. I will suggest two solutions. Download this opensource app
ProxyDroid from here <http://www.appszoom.com/android_applications/communication/proxydroid_xtmc_download.html> and try your luck. There many such proxy authentication apps on Google play too, to try those you should connect to some direct internet source using 3G/2G dongle or wifi hotspot from any compatible phone.

Second solution is bit complex.

In a GNU/Linux machine(assuming its IP to be 192.168.1.2) install squid3 proxy server(say on your laptop)

Then open */etc/squid3/squid.conf* file as sudo and add these lines at the end of the file after updating *username:password *field.

*http_port hostmachine-ip:3128
cache_peer netmon.iitb.ac.in <http://netmon.iitb.ac.in> parent 80 0 no-query default login=/username:password/
# No direct access
never_direct allow all

*Save and close the above file. Restart the squid3 sever by
*sudo service squid3 restart*

Now connect your aakash to a wifi, long press on connected wifi and select *modify network, *Then enable *Show advance options* *-> Proxy settings (select manual)
*Add your squid3 server's detail here
*Proxy hostname *192.168.1.2
*Proxy port *3128
*Bypass proxy for *iitb.ac.in <http://iitb.ac.in>, 127.0.0.1, localhost      (*.iitb.ac.in <http://iitb.ac.in> will not work)

Then add your static IP/Gateway/DNS as usual, and for
*Network prefix* give 16 (if your subnet mask is 255.255.0.0, if not sure search your value from net)

Save settings, disable and enable wifi to make it work.
Your gmail may not work properly but this will set internet system wide. The only disadvantage is you need to engage a machine to use this feature.

Srikant

POST.MESSAGE:
Sir,

If I may, I would like to point out that many of the users have special characters in their username/password. For them a small hack is to use URL escape characters in their settings. i.e. when configuring this line :

cache_peer netmon.iitb.ac.in <http://netmon.iitb.ac.in> parent 80 0 no-query default login=/username:password/

suppose username is arka and password is @rk@,

then the config line would be:

cache_peer netmon.iitb.ac.in <http://netmon.iitb.ac.in> parent 80 0 no-query default login=/arka:%40rk%40/


For a comprehensive list of URL escape characters one could refer to:

http://www.w3schools.com/tags/ref_urlencode.asp

Thanks!

Arka.

POST.SUBJECT: Re: Second Lab Doubts
POST.MESSAGE:
Hello Amol,

The Algedric loop error occurs because the feedback has no delay factor and hence is expected at the input instantenously. This error can be avoided by adding a very small delay factor in the feedback loop (explore the palette browser of Xcos to get the delay block). The inroduction of this delay factor may however affect the performance and one should be aware of it.

The other way of clossing the loop is by directly writing the control law in the steptest.sci file. This is the easiest approach since you already have the heat, fan and temperature variables available.

POST.SUBJECT: Re: Slide 21: Subtracting infinities
POST.MESSAGE:
I could have given a better explanation in the slide.  We can write the equation for e(m+1) as follows: $$e(m) = A^m e(0) + \cdots$$.  As $$A$$ has eigen values outside the unit circle, $$e$$ will be unbounded if $$e(0) \neq 0$$.
